title: 10 journalists receive Media Award on Judicial Independence 2025
body: For in-depth reporting on judicial independence, ten journalists, including The Daily Star's Senior Reporter Baharam Khan, have received Media Award on Judicial Independence 2025 in two categories. The National Institute of Mass Communication (NIMC) and the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) jointly organised the Media Award on Judicial Independence 2025. Certificates and prize money were handed over to the winners at an award ceremony held today at the NIMC auditorium on Darussalam Road in Dhaka. The awardees are Mohammad Didarul Alam (daily Ittefaq), Mohammad Gulam Rabbani (Financial Express), Abu Saleh Rony (Dainik Samakal), Baharam Khan (The Daily Star), Ehsanul Haque Jasim (Daily Sun), Md Iqbal Hossain (BTV), Shakera Arju (Ekushey TV), Habibul Islam (Star News), Asadur Rahman (Radio Padma) and Syeda Sabrina Mojumder (Desh TV). Five journalists received the award in the "Print and Online" category, while five others in "Television and Radio category. Mahbuba Farjana, secretary of the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, attended the event as the chief guest, while Shahed Mohammad Ali, editor of the daily Samakal, Mohammad Moazzem Hossain, registrar of the High Court Division of the Supreme Court, Anowarul Haq, assistant resident representative of UNDP Bangladesh, Abdul Qayyum, head of communications of UNDP Bangladesh, also spoke at the event. Muhammad Hiruzzaman, director general of NIMC, presided over the programme.
